headline.print_headline: Is a ‘No Fun’ Sign Next? Pollution Concerns May Douse California Beach Fires
headline.seo: Pollution Concerns Could Douse California Beach Fires
headline.main: Is ‘No Fun’ Sign Next? California Beach Bonfires May Be Doused

docs.abstract: Air quality regulators, citing pollution and health risks, have proposed removing more than 800 fire pits that dot coastline of Los Angeles and Orange Counties, heartland of Southern California beach culture; residents view effort as assault on their local way of life.
docs.lead_paragraph: Air quality regulators, citing pollution and health risks, have proposed removing more than 800 fire pits that dot the coastline of Los Angeles and Orange Counties.
docs.snippet: Air quality regulators, citing pollution and health risks, have proposed removing more than 800 fire pits that dot the coastline of Los Angeles and Orange Counties.

headline.print_headline: Employers Get Leeway On Health Incentives
headline.seo: New Rules Give Employers Leeway on Use of Health Incentives
headline.main: Employers Get Leeway on Health Incentives

docs.abstract: Obama administration issues final rule that gives employers greater leeway to use employee wellness programs; it allows employers to reward or penalize employees who meet specific standards related to their health.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: National Partnership for Women and Families
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration issued a rule that employers could reward or penalize employees who meet specific standards related to their health.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration issued a rule that employers could reward or penalize employees who meet specific standards related to their health.

headline.main: Is Obamacare Too Complicated to Succeed?

docs.abstract: Are opponents of the Affordable Care Act pointing out serious flaws, or manufacturing obstacles for political gain?
docs.snippet: Are opponents of the Affordable Care Act pointing out serious flaws, or manufacturing obstacles for political gain?
